originalText.text: Relax. Take it easy. It's NYC

text.text: Relax. Take it easy. It's NYC

originalText.text: It is one of the better shelters in NYC in terms of how staff runs the place. It can be a good place to meet friends, network, and get your life together. On the other hand, there is a lot of negative aspects. The rooms are not always cleaned well because staff is busting their behind packing people's stufd up if they miss just one day of their bed. Almost all hundreds of the women there miss at least one day of their bed.

text.text: It is one of the better shelters in NYC in terms of how staff runs the place. It can be a good place to meet friends, network, and get your life together. originalText.text:
Very hostile environment, staff are absolutely miserable and talk to you like your existence is worthless. Not every homeless person is trying to snub off the government. I can count on 1 hand how many people have spoken to me with the same respect I've given them and that's very sad because this shelter is packed with workers,security,caseworkers,office employees,etc;
Office staff gave me such a hard time when I was leaving and I asked to get my belongings from my room. It is very disturbing how they treat human life. I'm certain they go to work for a paycheck and could careless about helping anyone. The tables could easily be reversed, they need to seriously humble themselves. I will be reporting and making a complaint.

originalText.text:
When Does HIPAA Allow Hospitals to Give Patient Information to Police?

Name and address
Date and place of birth
Social Security Number
ABO blood type and rh factor
Type of injury
Date and time of treatment
Date and time of death, if applicable

Description of distinguishing physical characteristics including height, weight, gender, race, hair/eye color, facial hair, scars or tattoos

Additional information can be released by a hospital to comply with a court order, subpoena or summons issued by a judicial officer or grand jury; or to respond to an administrative subpoena or INVESTIGATIVE DEMAND IF THAT DEMAND COMES WITH A WRITTEN STATEMENT THAT THE PATIENT INFORMATION IS RELEVANT AND LIMITED IN SCOPE

originalText.text: I was herassed by another resident right in my room back in February wasn’t evn my roommate I have been in orthopedics since & they wouldn’t have the girl arrested  she still free & it’s been 6 months & I am still injured haven’t evn been put on physical therapy yet shelter says basically since it’s the first time they won’t do anything I’m no longer there & their still getting money for me saying I’m there when I’m not
